SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: All requirements emphasize the importance of compliance with data privacy regulations to ensure user data security and privacy.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-001 focuses specifically on healthcare regulations (HIPAA and GDPR), while P-005 and P-007 cover broader data privacy regulations without specifying particular ones.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Data Privacy and Security Compliance
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall comply with relevant healthcare and data privacy regulations to ensure the security and privacy of user data, providing users with control over their personal information and fostering trust.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements focus on the user experience during periods of high demand, ensuring that the system remains functional and responsive.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-002 addresses performance concerns specifically during peak usage related to privacy settings, while P-004 emphasizes offline functionality for health tracking.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Performance and Offline Functionality
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall maintain optimal performance and responsiveness during peak usage times and provide offline functionality for health monitoring and reminders to ensure usability in areas with poor internet connectivity.

Conflicts.Note: The requirement for strict compliance (P-001) may introduce complexities that could hinder user interaction and control over personal data as outlined in P-005.

Conflicts.PersonaConflict: Privacy Advocate vs Health Tracker Users
Conflicts.Note: The emphasis on system performance during peak times (P-002) may conflict with delivering reliable offline functionality (P-004), particularly in scenarios where users need access to data without internet connectivity.
